greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of digits of (n written in base 5).
comment: Also the fixed point of the morphism 0->{0,1,2,3,4}, 1->{1,2,3,4,5}, 2->{2,3,4,5,6}, etc. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006
a(n) = A138530(n,5) for n > 4. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 26 2008
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3125=5^5
Robert Walker, Self Similar Sloth Canon Number Sequences
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Sum
formula: If i >= 2, a(2^i) mod 4 = 0. - _Washington Bomfim_, Jan 01 2011
example: a(20) = 4 + 0 = 4 because 20 is written as 40 in base 5.
It appears that this can be written as a triangle (see the conjecture in the entry A000120):
mathematica: Nest[Flatten[ #1 /. a_Integer -> Table[a + i, {i, 0, 4}]] &, {0}, 4] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006 *)
program: a053824 x = a053824 x' + d  where (x', d) = divMod x 5
xref: Cf. A173670 (last nonzero decimal digit of (10^n)!). - _Washington Bomfim_, Jan 01 2011
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 28 2000
